title: 104_hr192
content: The Act is titled the "Homeless Children's Immunization Assistance Act." It establishes the Emergency Shelter Grants Program. The Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act is amended to include child immunization services for children under 6 years old, in line with Surgeon General recommendations. Eligible activities now include providing transportation and counseling for child immunization services. The Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act is amended to include child immunization services for children under 6 years old. This includes providing information, counseling, and coordinating immunization at facilities. The Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act is amended to include child immunization services for children under 6 years old, ensuring that children in assisted facilities are immunized according to recommendations. The Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act is amended to require recipients of assistance to make efforts to determine and provide child immunization information for children under 6 years old in assisted facilities. SEC. 3. Transitional housing under supportive housing program. The Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act is amended to include a definition of child immunization for children under 6 years old. It also requires assistance in obtaining child immunizations as part of supportive services provided in connection with a project. The Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act now includes a provision for determining the immunization status of children under 6 years old in transitional housing projects. Recipients of assistance must make efforts to obtain immunization records for these children within 60 days of occupancy. The Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act requires recipients to determine the immunization status of children in transitional housing projects and provide information and transportation for child immunization services. The Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act now includes a requirement for supportive housing projects to assist children under 6 years old in obtaining immunizations if they have not already been immunized according to the Surgeon General's recommendations.
